p.s: Most people do n't play with robots , so you will need to buy one .
There are many sites that offer robots , and you will need to know how to buy one .

list.item:
Log on .
Log on to your computer .
Open a new browser tab and take care of anything that needs to be taken care of .
Finally , get to a clean search engine page .

item.s: Deciding where you will buy the robot .
Many places offer robots for sale .
You will have to decide where you want to buy your robot .
Do you want to buy it by auction ( eBay ) or standard money ( Amazon ) ?
Do you want it new or used ?
There are many steps to make the final decision .
Searching for your robot .
Once you have made up basic preferences , search them .
Be sure to be as specific as possible .
If no results show up , check your spelling , then reword your search .
Click on results to read basic details .
Find a robot that is in your price range and works for you .
Purchase your robot .
Most sites require you to make an account then add money and your information to the account .
Most sites also require that you are 18+ years old .
Once you have made an account and verified you are eligible to purchase the robot , buy it .
Eventually , your robot will arrive in the mail .

item.s: Deciding on the robot .
There are many different types of robots .
Each has their own special qualities , so see which best match you .
Read robot catalogs of many sites to make your final decision .
Be sure to read reviews on the robot .
After researching , find the model you want .
Many stores will probably sell the same model .
Chose the store you want and purchase ... .
Purchase your robot .
Most sites require you to make an account then add money and your information to the account .
Most sites also require that you are 18+ years old .
Once you have made an account and verified you are eligible to purchase the robot , buy it .
Eventually , your robot will arrive in the mail .
Check different sites to see which have the cheapest price .
Also , make sure the sites you use to purchase the robots are reliable .
Unreliable shops can steal your information .
Read reviews to see how well the robot performs and where and how it can best run .
Reviews often have useful tips in them .
Do n't solely base your purchase on reviews though .
Try to find sites that have a guarantee or warranty under their products .
If the robot malfunctions , you can always return the robot for a refund or a functional robot .
If a site seems to ask for too much information(social security numbers , etc. ) that wo n't be needed to make the purchase , do n't enter it .
The site might steal this information .
Unreliable sites may steal the information you enter onto their site .
Check their site credits and/or computer safety software before you begin entering key information .
